frameDefinitions: An Agent saves a Patient or an Asset from a Harmful_situation.
A salient Subevent has a Pattern of recurrence within a larger Process.
frameExamples: Israeli commandos <t>rescued</t> the hostages and left.
Tony's fingers tapped <t>rhythmically</t> on the keyboard
listRoleDefinitions: The sentient being who rescues the <fen>Patient</fen> or <fen>Asset</fen> from the <fen>Harmful_situation</fen>.
The living being who is rescued by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The entity that is judged to be valueable which might be lost or damaged by the <fen>Harmful_situation</fen>.
An event that occurs which could result in injury or harm to the <fen>Patient</fen> or <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> rescues the <fen>Patient</fen> or <fen>Asset</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> rescues the <fen>Patient</fen> or <fen>Asset</fen>.
The larger event that is characterized by the recurring Subevents.
The salient, punctual event that is construed as part of a <fen>Process</fen>.
The <fen>Pattern</fen> that can be detected in the recurrence of  the <fen>Subevent</fen>s of the <fen>Process</fen> .
listRoleExamples: <fex>He</fex> rescued the innocent girl from a fate worse than death.
<fex>Three foxes</fex> were saved from being savagely ripped apart.
She saved <fex>countless lives</fex> during her short stay on the plantation.
Three foxes were saved <fex>from being savagely ripped apart</fex>.
She saved my life on the bridge <fex>yesterday</fex>.
She saved my life <fex>on the bridge</fex> yesterday.
The rhythm <fex>of the rain falling on the roof</fex> kept me awake
The music had a driving rhythm
